3856CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitObjCMessageExpr(ObjCMessageExpr *ME,
3857 AddStmtChoice asc) {
3858 findConstructionContextsForArguments(ME);
3859
3860 autoCreateBlock();
3861 appendObjCMessage(Block, ME);
3862
3863 return VisitChildren(ME);
3864}
3865
3866CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXThrowExpr(CXXThrowExpr *T) {
3867 // If we were in the middle of a block we stop processing that block.
3868 if (badCFG)
3869 return nullptr;
3870
3871 // Create the new block.
3872 Block = createBlock(false);
3873
3874 if (TryTerminatedBlock)
3875 // The current try statement is the only successor.
3876 addSuccessor(Block, TryTerminatedBlock);
3877 else
3878 // otherwise the Exit block is the only successor.
3879 addSuccessor(Block, &cfg->getExit());
3880
3881 // Add the statement to the block. This may create new blocks if S contains
3882 // control-flow (short-circuit operations).
3883 return VisitStmt(T, AddStmtChoice::AlwaysAdd);
3884}
3885
3886CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitDoStmt(DoStmt *D) {
3887 CFGBlock *LoopSuccessor = nullptr;
3888
3889 addLoopExit(D);
3890
3891 // "do...while" is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the
3892 // current block.
3893 if (Block) {
3894 if (badCFG)
3895 return nullptr;
3896 LoopSuccessor = Block;
3897 } else
3898 LoopSuccessor = Succ;
3899
3900 // Because of short-circuit evaluation, the condition of the loop can span
3901 // multiple basic blocks. Thus we need the "Entry" and "Exit" blocks that
3902 // evaluate the condition.
3903 CFGBlock *ExitConditionBlock = createBlock(false);
3904 CFGBlock *EntryConditionBlock = ExitConditionBlock;
3905
3906 // Set the terminator for the "exit" condition block.
3907 ExitConditionBlock->setTerminator(D);
3908
3909 // Now add the actual condition to the condition block. Because the condition
3910 // itself may contain control-flow, new blocks may be created.
3911 if (Stmt *C = D->getCond()) {
3912 Block = ExitConditionBlock;
3913 EntryConditionBlock = addStmt(C);
3914 if (Block) {
3915 if (badCFG)
3916 return nullptr;
3917 }
3918 }
3919
3920 // The condition block is the implicit successor for the loop body.
3921 Succ = EntryConditionBlock;
3922
3923 // See if this is a known constant.
3924 const TryResult &KnownVal = tryEvaluateBool(D->getCond());
3925
3926 // Process the loop body.
3927 CFGBlock *BodyBlock = nullptr;
3928 {
3929 assert(D->getBody());
3930
3931 // Save the current values for Block, Succ, and continue and break targets
3932 SaveAndRestore<CFGBlock*> save_Block(Block), save_Succ(Succ);
3933 SaveAndRestore<JumpTarget> save_continue(ContinueJumpTarget),
3934 save_break(BreakJumpTarget);
3935
3936 // All continues within this loop should go to the condition block
3937 ContinueJumpTarget = JumpTarget(EntryConditionBlock, ScopePos);
3938
3939 // All breaks should go to the code following the loop.
3940 BreakJumpTarget = JumpTarget(LoopSuccessor, ScopePos);
3941
3942 // NULL out Block to force lazy instantiation of blocks for the body.
3943 Block = nullptr;
3944
3945 // If body is not a compound statement create implicit scope
3946 // and add destructors.
3947 if (!isa<CompoundStmt>(D->getBody()))
3948 addLocalScopeAndDtors(D->getBody());
3949
3950 // Create the body. The returned block is the entry to the loop body.
3951 BodyBlock = addStmt(D->getBody());
3952
3953 if (!BodyBlock)
3954 BodyBlock = EntryConditionBlock; // can happen for "do ; while(...)"
3955 else if (Block) {
3956 if (badCFG)
3957 return nullptr;
3958 }
3959
3960 // Add an intermediate block between the BodyBlock and the
3961 // ExitConditionBlock to represent the "loop back" transition. Create an
3962 // empty block to represent the transition block for looping back to the
3963 // head of the loop.
3964 // FIXME: Can we do this more efficiently without adding another block?
3965 Block = nullptr;
3966 Succ = BodyBlock;
3967 CFGBlock *LoopBackBlock = createBlock();
3968 LoopBackBlock->setLoopTarget(D);
3969
3970 if (!KnownVal.isFalse())
3971 // Add the loop body entry as a successor to the condition.
3972 addSuccessor(ExitConditionBlock, LoopBackBlock);
3973 else
3974 addSuccessor(ExitConditionBlock, nullptr);
3975 }
3976
3977 // Link up the condition block with the code that follows the loop.
3978 // (the false branch).
3979 addSuccessor(ExitConditionBlock, KnownVal.isTrue() ? nullptr : LoopSuccessor);
3980
3981 // There can be no more statements in the body block(s) since we loop back to
3982 // the body. NULL out Block to force lazy creation of another block.
3983 Block = nullptr;
3984
3985 // Return the loop body, which is the dominating block for the loop.
3986 Succ = BodyBlock;
3987 return BodyBlock;
3988}
3989
3990CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitContinueStmt(ContinueStmt *C) {
3991 // "continue" is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the
3992 // current block.
3993 if (badCFG)
3994 return nullptr;
3995
3996 // Now create a new block that ends with the continue statement.
3997 Block = createBlock(false);
3998 Block->setTerminator(C);
3999
4000 // If there is no target for the continue, then we are looking at an
4001 // incomplete AST. This means the CFG cannot be constructed.
4002 if (ContinueJumpTarget.block) {
4003 addAutomaticObjHandling(ScopePos, ContinueJumpTarget.scopePosition, C);
4004 addSuccessor(Block, ContinueJumpTarget.block);
4005 } else
4006 badCFG = true;
4007
4008 return Block;
4009}
4010
4011CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitUnaryExprOrTypeTraitExpr(UnaryExprOrTypeTraitExpr *E,
4012 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4013 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, E)) {
4014 autoCreateBlock();
4015 appendStmt(Block, E);
4016 }
4017
4018 // VLA types have expressions that must be evaluated.
4019 // Evaluation is done only for `sizeof`.
4020
4021 if (E->getKind() != UETT_SizeOf)
4022 return Block;
4023
4024 CFGBlock *lastBlock = Block;
4025
4026 if (E->isArgumentType()) {
4027 for (const VariableArrayType *VA =FindVA(E->getArgumentType().getTypePtr());
4028 VA != nullptr; VA = FindVA(VA->getElementType().getTypePtr()))
4029 lastBlock = addStmt(VA->getSizeExpr());
4030 }
4031 return lastBlock;
4032}
4033
4034/// VisitStmtExpr - Utility method to handle (nested) statement
4035/// expressions (a GCC extension).
4036CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitStmtExpr(StmtExpr *SE, AddStmtChoice asc) {
4037 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, SE)) {
4038 autoCreateBlock();
4039 appendStmt(Block, SE);
4040 }
4041 return VisitCompoundStmt(SE->getSubStmt(), /*ExternallyDestructed=*/true);
4042}
4043
4044CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitSwitchStmt(SwitchStmt *Terminator) {
4045 // "switch" is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the current
4046 // block.
4047 CFGBlock *SwitchSuccessor = nullptr;
4048
4049 // Save local scope position because in case of condition variable ScopePos
4050 // won't be restored when traversing AST.
4051 SaveAndRestore<LocalScope::const_iterator> save_scope_pos(ScopePos);
4052
4053 // Create local scope for C++17 switch init-stmt if one exists.
4054 if (Stmt *Init = Terminator->getInit())
4055 addLocalScopeForStmt(Init);
4056
4057 // Create local scope for possible condition variable.
4058 // Store scope position. Add implicit destructor.
4059 if (VarDecl *VD = Terminator->getConditionVariable())
4060 addLocalScopeForVarDecl(VD);
4061
4062 addAutomaticObjHandling(ScopePos, save_scope_pos.get(), Terminator);
4063
4064 if (Block) {
4065 if (badCFG)
4066 return nullptr;
4067 SwitchSuccessor = Block;
4068 } else SwitchSuccessor = Succ;
4069
4070 // Save the current "switch" context.
4071 SaveAndRestore<CFGBlock*> save_switch(SwitchTerminatedBlock),
4072 save_default(DefaultCaseBlock);
4073 SaveAndRestore<JumpTarget> save_break(BreakJumpTarget);
4074
4075 // Set the "default" case to be the block after the switch statement. If the
4076 // switch statement contains a "default:", this value will be overwritten with
4077 // the block for that code.
4078 DefaultCaseBlock = SwitchSuccessor;
4079
4080 // Create a new block that will contain the switch statement.
4081 SwitchTerminatedBlock = createBlock(false);
4082
4083 // Now process the switch body. The code after the switch is the implicit
4084 // successor.
4085 Succ = SwitchSuccessor;
4086 BreakJumpTarget = JumpTarget(SwitchSuccessor, ScopePos);
4087
4088 // When visiting the body, the case statements should automatically get linked
4089 // up to the switch. We also don't keep a pointer to the body, since all
4090 // control-flow from the switch goes to case/default statements.
4091 assert(Terminator->getBody() && "switch must contain a non-NULL body");
4092 Block = nullptr;
4093
4094 // For pruning unreachable case statements, save the current state
4095 // for tracking the condition value.
4096 SaveAndRestore<bool> save_switchExclusivelyCovered(switchExclusivelyCovered,
4097 false);
4098
4099 // Determine if the switch condition can be explicitly evaluated.
4100 assert(Terminator->getCond() && "switch condition must be non-NULL");
4101 Expr::EvalResult result;
4102 bool b = tryEvaluate(Terminator->getCond(), result);
4103 SaveAndRestore<Expr::EvalResult*> save_switchCond(switchCond,
4104 b ? &result : nullptr);
4105
4106 // If body is not a compound statement create implicit scope
4107 // and add destructors.
4108 if (!isa<CompoundStmt>(Terminator->getBody()))
4109 addLocalScopeAndDtors(Terminator->getBody());
4110
4111 addStmt(Terminator->getBody());
4112 if (Block) {
4113 if (badCFG)
4114 return nullptr;
4115 }
4116
4117 // If we have no "default:" case, the default transition is to the code
4118 // following the switch body. Moreover, take into account if all the
4119 // cases of a switch are covered (e.g., switching on an enum value).
4120 //
4121 // Note: We add a successor to a switch that is considered covered yet has no
4122 // case statements if the enumeration has no enumerators.
4123 bool SwitchAlwaysHasSuccessor = false;
4124 SwitchAlwaysHasSuccessor |= switchExclusivelyCovered;
4125 SwitchAlwaysHasSuccessor |= Terminator->isAllEnumCasesCovered() &&
4126 Terminator->getSwitchCaseList();
4127 addSuccessor(SwitchTerminatedBlock, DefaultCaseBlock,
4128 !SwitchAlwaysHasSuccessor);
4129
4130 // Add the terminator and condition in the switch block.
4131 SwitchTerminatedBlock->setTerminator(Terminator);
4132 Block = SwitchTerminatedBlock;
4133 CFGBlock *LastBlock = addStmt(Terminator->getCond());
4134
4135 // If the SwitchStmt contains a condition variable, add both the
4136 // SwitchStmt and the condition variable initialization to the CFG.
4137 if (VarDecl *VD = Terminator->getConditionVariable()) {
4138 if (Expr *Init = VD->getInit()) {
4139 autoCreateBlock();
4140 appendStmt(Block, Terminator->getConditionVariableDeclStmt());
4141 LastBlock = addStmt(Init);
4142 maybeAddScopeBeginForVarDecl(LastBlock, VD, Init);
4143 }
4144 }
4145
4146 // Finally, if the SwitchStmt contains a C++17 init-stmt, add it to the CFG.
4147 if (Stmt *Init = Terminator->getInit()) {
4148 autoCreateBlock();
4149 LastBlock = addStmt(Init);
4150 }
4151
4152 return LastBlock;
4153}
4154
4155static bool shouldAddCase(bool &switchExclusivelyCovered,
4156 const Expr::EvalResult *switchCond,
4157 const CaseStmt *CS,
4158 ASTContext &Ctx) {
4159 if (!switchCond)
4160 return true;
4161
4162 bool addCase = false;
4163
4164 if (!switchExclusivelyCovered) {
4165 if (switchCond->Val.isInt()) {
4166 // Evaluate the LHS of the case value.
4167 const llvm::APSInt &lhsInt = CS->getLHS()->EvaluateKnownConstInt(Ctx);
4168 const llvm::APSInt &condInt = switchCond->Val.getInt();
4169
4170 if (condInt == lhsInt) {
4171 addCase = true;
4172 switchExclusivelyCovered = true;
4173 }
4174 else if (condInt > lhsInt) {
4175 if (const Expr *RHS = CS->getRHS()) {
4176 // Evaluate the RHS of the case value.
4177 const llvm::APSInt &V2 = RHS->EvaluateKnownConstInt(Ctx);
4178 if (V2 >= condInt) {
4179 addCase = true;
4180 switchExclusivelyCovered = true;
4181 }
4182 }
4183 }
4184 }
4185 else
4186 addCase = true;
4187 }
4188 return addCase;
4189}
4190
4191CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCaseStmt(CaseStmt *CS) {
4192 // CaseStmts are essentially labels, so they are the first statement in a
4193 // block.
4194 CFGBlock *TopBlock = nullptr, *LastBlock = nullptr;
4195
4196 if (Stmt *Sub = CS->getSubStmt()) {
4197 // For deeply nested chains of CaseStmts, instead of doing a recursion
4198 // (which can blow out the stack), manually unroll and create blocks
4199 // along the way.
4200 while (isa<CaseStmt>(Sub)) {
4201 CFGBlock *currentBlock = createBlock(false);
4202 currentBlock->setLabel(CS);
4203
4204 if (TopBlock)
4205 addSuccessor(LastBlock, currentBlock);
4206 else
4207 TopBlock = currentBlock;
4208
4209 addSuccessor(SwitchTerminatedBlock,
4210 shouldAddCase(switchExclusivelyCovered, switchCond,
4211 CS, *Context)
4212 ? currentBlock : nullptr);
4213
4214 LastBlock = currentBlock;
4215 CS = cast<CaseStmt>(Sub);
4216 Sub = CS->getSubStmt();
4217 }
4218
4219 addStmt(Sub);
4220 }
4221
4222 CFGBlock *CaseBlock = Block;
4223 if (!CaseBlock)
4224 CaseBlock = createBlock();
4225
4226 // Cases statements partition blocks, so this is the top of the basic block we
4227 // were processing (the "case XXX:" is the label).
4228 CaseBlock->setLabel(CS);
4229
4230 if (badCFG)
4231 return nullptr;
4232
4233 // Add this block to the list of successors for the block with the switch
4234 // statement.
4235 assert(SwitchTerminatedBlock);
4236 addSuccessor(SwitchTerminatedBlock, CaseBlock,
4237 shouldAddCase(switchExclusivelyCovered, switchCond,
4238 CS, *Context));
4239
4240 // We set Block to NULL to allow lazy creation of a new block (if necessary)
4241 Block = nullptr;
4242
4243 if (TopBlock) {
4244 addSuccessor(LastBlock, CaseBlock);
4245 Succ = TopBlock;
4246 } else {
4247 // This block is now the implicit successor of other blocks.
4248 Succ = CaseBlock;
4249 }
4250
4251 return Succ;
4252}
4253
4254CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitDefaultStmt(DefaultStmt *Terminator) {
4255 if (Terminator->getSubStmt())
4256 addStmt(Terminator->getSubStmt());
4257
4258 DefaultCaseBlock = Block;
4259
4260 if (!DefaultCaseBlock)
4261 DefaultCaseBlock = createBlock();
4262
4263 // Default statements partition blocks, so this is the top of the basic block
4264 // we were processing (the "default:" is the label).
4265 DefaultCaseBlock->setLabel(Terminator);
4266
4267 if (badCFG)
4268 return nullptr;
4269
4270 // Unlike case statements, we don't add the default block to the successors
4271 // for the switch statement immediately. This is done when we finish
4272 // processing the switch statement. This allows for the default case
4273 // (including a fall-through to the code after the switch statement) to always
4274 // be the last successor of a switch-terminated block.
4275
4276 // We set Block to NULL to allow lazy creation of a new block (if necessary)
4277 Block = nullptr;
4278
4279 // This block is now the implicit successor of other blocks.
4280 Succ = DefaultCaseBlock;
4281
4282 return DefaultCaseBlock;
4283}
4284
4285CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXTryStmt(CXXTryStmt *Terminator) {
4286 // "try"/"catch" is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the
4287 // current block.
4288 CFGBlock *TrySuccessor = nullptr;
4289
4290 if (Block) {
4291 if (badCFG)
4292 return nullptr;
4293 TrySuccessor = Block;
4294 } else TrySuccessor = Succ;
4295
4296 CFGBlock *PrevTryTerminatedBlock = TryTerminatedBlock;
4297
4298 // Create a new block that will contain the try statement.
4299 CFGBlock *NewTryTerminatedBlock = createBlock(false);
4300 // Add the terminator in the try block.
4301 NewTryTerminatedBlock->setTerminator(Terminator);
4302
4303 bool HasCatchAll = false;
4304 for (unsigned h = 0; h <Terminator->getNumHandlers(); ++h) {
4305 // The code after the try is the implicit successor.
4306 Succ = TrySuccessor;
4307 CXXCatchStmt *CS = Terminator->getHandler(h);
4308 if (CS->getExceptionDecl() == nullptr) {
4309 HasCatchAll = true;
4310 }
4311 Block = nullptr;
4312 CFGBlock *CatchBlock = VisitCXXCatchStmt(CS);
4313 if (!CatchBlock)
4314 return nullptr;
4315 // Add this block to the list of successors for the block with the try
4316 // statement.
4317 addSuccessor(NewTryTerminatedBlock, CatchBlock);
4318 }
4319 if (!HasCatchAll) {
4320 if (PrevTryTerminatedBlock)
4321 addSuccessor(NewTryTerminatedBlock, PrevTryTerminatedBlock);
4322 else
4323 addSuccessor(NewTryTerminatedBlock, &cfg->getExit());
4324 }
4325
4326 // The code after the try is the implicit successor.
4327 Succ = TrySuccessor;
4328
4329 // Save the current "try" context.
4330 SaveAndRestore<CFGBlock*> save_try(TryTerminatedBlock, NewTryTerminatedBlock);
4331 cfg->addTryDispatchBlock(TryTerminatedBlock);
4332
4333 assert(Terminator->getTryBlock() && "try must contain a non-NULL body");
4334 Block = nullptr;
4335 return addStmt(Terminator->getTryBlock());
4336}
4337
4338CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXCatchStmt(CXXCatchStmt *CS) {
4339 // CXXCatchStmt are treated like labels, so they are the first statement in a
4340 // block.
4341
4342 // Save local scope position because in case of exception variable ScopePos
4343 // won't be restored when traversing AST.
4344 SaveAndRestore<LocalScope::const_iterator> save_scope_pos(ScopePos);
4345
4346 // Create local scope for possible exception variable.
4347 // Store scope position. Add implicit destructor.
4348 if (VarDecl *VD = CS->getExceptionDecl()) {
4349 LocalScope::const_iterator BeginScopePos = ScopePos;
4350 addLocalScopeForVarDecl(VD);
4351 addAutomaticObjHandling(ScopePos, BeginScopePos, CS);
4352 }
4353
4354 if (CS->getHandlerBlock())
4355 addStmt(CS->getHandlerBlock());
4356
4357 CFGBlock *CatchBlock = Block;
4358 if (!CatchBlock)
4359 CatchBlock = createBlock();
4360
4361 // CXXCatchStmt is more than just a label. They have semantic meaning
4362 // as well, as they implicitly "initialize" the catch variable. Add
4363 // it to the CFG as a CFGElement so that the control-flow of these
4364 // semantics gets captured.
4365 appendStmt(CatchBlock, CS);
4366
4367 // Also add the CXXCatchStmt as a label, to mirror handling of regular
4368 // labels.
4369 CatchBlock->setLabel(CS);
4370
4371 // Bail out if the CFG is bad.
4372 if (badCFG)
4373 return nullptr;
4374
4375 // We set Block to NULL to allow lazy creation of a new block (if necessary)
4376 Block = nullptr;
4377
4378 return CatchBlock;
4379}
4380
4381CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXForRangeStmt(CXXForRangeStmt *S) {
4382 // C++0x for-range statements are specified as [stmt.ranged]:
4383 //
4384 // {
4385 // auto && __range = range-init;
4386 // for ( auto __begin = begin-expr,
4387 // __end = end-expr;
4388 // __begin != __end;
4389 // ++__begin ) {
4390 // for-range-declaration = *__begin;
4391 // statement
4392 // }
4393 // }
4394
4395 // Save local scope position before the addition of the implicit variables.
4396 SaveAndRestore<LocalScope::const_iterator> save_scope_pos(ScopePos);
4397
4398 // Create local scopes and destructors for range, begin and end variables.
4399 if (Stmt *Range = S->getRangeStmt())
4400 addLocalScopeForStmt(Range);
4401 if (Stmt *Begin = S->getBeginStmt())
4402 addLocalScopeForStmt(Begin);
4403 if (Stmt *End = S->getEndStmt())
4404 addLocalScopeForStmt(End);
4405 addAutomaticObjHandling(ScopePos, save_scope_pos.get(), S);
4406
4407 LocalScope::const_iterator ContinueScopePos = ScopePos;
4408
4409 // "for" is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the current
4410 // block.
4411 CFGBlock *LoopSuccessor = nullptr;
4412 if (Block) {
4413 if (badCFG)
4414 return nullptr;
4415 LoopSuccessor = Block;
4416 } else
4417 LoopSuccessor = Succ;
4418
4419 // Save the current value for the break targets.
4420 // All breaks should go to the code following the loop.
4421 SaveAndRestore<JumpTarget> save_break(BreakJumpTarget);
4422 BreakJumpTarget = JumpTarget(LoopSuccessor, ScopePos);
4423
4424 // The block for the __begin != __end expression.
4425 CFGBlock *ConditionBlock = createBlock(false);
4426 ConditionBlock->setTerminator(S);
4427
4428 // Now add the actual condition to the condition block.
4429 if (Expr *C = S->getCond()) {
4430 Block = ConditionBlock;
4431 CFGBlock *BeginConditionBlock = addStmt(C);
4432 if (badCFG)
4433 return nullptr;
4434 assert(BeginConditionBlock == ConditionBlock &&
4435 "condition block in for-range was unexpectedly complex");
4436 (void)BeginConditionBlock;
4437 }
4438
4439 // The condition block is the implicit successor for the loop body as well as
4440 // any code above the loop.
4441 Succ = ConditionBlock;
4442
4443 // See if this is a known constant.
4444 TryResult KnownVal(true);
4445
4446 if (S->getCond())
4447 KnownVal = tryEvaluateBool(S->getCond());
4448
4449 // Now create the loop body.
4450 {
4451 assert(S->getBody());
4452
4453 // Save the current values for Block, Succ, and continue targets.
4454 SaveAndRestore<CFGBlock*> save_Block(Block), save_Succ(Succ);
4455 SaveAndRestore<JumpTarget> save_continue(ContinueJumpTarget);
4456
4457 // Generate increment code in its own basic block. This is the target of
4458 // continue statements.
4459 Block = nullptr;
4460 Succ = addStmt(S->getInc());
4461 if (badCFG)
4462 return nullptr;
4463 ContinueJumpTarget = JumpTarget(Succ, ContinueScopePos);
4464
4465 // The starting block for the loop increment is the block that should
4466 // represent the 'loop target' for looping back to the start of the loop.
4467 ContinueJumpTarget.block->setLoopTarget(S);
4468
4469 // Finish up the increment block and prepare to start the loop body.
4470 assert(Block);
4471 if (badCFG)
4472 return nullptr;
4473 Block = nullptr;
4474
4475 // Add implicit scope and dtors for loop variable.
4476 addLocalScopeAndDtors(S->getLoopVarStmt());
4477
4478 // Populate a new block to contain the loop body and loop variable.
4479 addStmt(S->getBody());
4480 if (badCFG)
4481 return nullptr;
4482 CFGBlock *LoopVarStmtBlock = addStmt(S->getLoopVarStmt());
4483 if (badCFG)
4484 return nullptr;
4485
4486 // This new body block is a successor to our condition block.
4487 addSuccessor(ConditionBlock,
4488 KnownVal.isFalse() ? nullptr : LoopVarStmtBlock);
4489 }
4490
4491 // Link up the condition block with the code that follows the loop (the
4492 // false branch).
4493 addSuccessor(ConditionBlock, KnownVal.isTrue() ? nullptr : LoopSuccessor);
4494
4495 // Add the initialization statements.
4496 Block = createBlock();
4497 addStmt(S->getBeginStmt());
4498 addStmt(S->getEndStmt());
4499 CFGBlock *Head = addStmt(S->getRangeStmt());
4500 if (S->getInit())
4501 Head = addStmt(S->getInit());
4502 return Head;
4503}
4504
4505CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitExprWithCleanups(ExprWithCleanups *E,
4506 AddStmtChoice asc, bool ExternallyDestructed) {
4507 if (BuildOpts.AddTemporaryDtors) {
4508 // If adding implicit destructors visit the full expression for adding
4509 // destructors of temporaries.
4510 TempDtorContext Context;
4511 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getSubExpr(), ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4512
4513 // Full expression has to be added as CFGStmt so it will be sequenced
4514 // before destructors of it's temporaries.
4515 asc = asc.withAlwaysAdd(true);
4516 }
4517 return Visit(E->getSubExpr(), asc);
4518}
4519
4520CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXBindTemporaryExpr(CXXBindTemporaryExpr *E,
4521 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4522 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, E)) {
4523 autoCreateBlock();
4524 appendStmt(Block, E);
4525
4526 findConstructionContexts(
4527 ConstructionContextLayer::create(cfg->getBumpVectorContext(), E),
4528 E->getSubExpr());
4529
4530 // We do not want to propagate the AlwaysAdd property.
4531 asc = asc.withAlwaysAdd(false);
4532 }
4533 return Visit(E->getSubExpr(), asc);
4534}
4535
4536CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXConstructExpr(CXXConstructExpr *C,
4537 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4538 // If the constructor takes objects as arguments by value, we need to properly
4539 // construct these objects. Construction contexts we find here aren't for the
4540 // constructor C, they're for its arguments only.
4541 findConstructionContextsForArguments(C);
4542
4543 autoCreateBlock();
4544 appendConstructor(Block, C);
4545
4546 return VisitChildren(C);
4547}
4548
4549CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXNewExpr(CXXNewExpr *NE,
4550 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4551 autoCreateBlock();
4552 appendStmt(Block, NE);
4553
4554 findConstructionContexts(
4555 ConstructionContextLayer::create(cfg->getBumpVectorContext(), NE),
4556 const_cast<CXXConstructExpr *>(NE->getConstructExpr()));
4557
4558 if (NE->getInitializer())
4559 Block = Visit(NE->getInitializer());
4560
4561 if (BuildOpts.AddCXXNewAllocator)
4562 appendNewAllocator(Block, NE);
4563
4564 if (NE->isArray() && *NE->getArraySize())
4565 Block = Visit(*NE->getArraySize());
4566
4567 for (CXXNewExpr::arg_iterator I = NE->placement_arg_begin(),
4568 E = NE->placement_arg_end(); I != E; ++I)
4569 Block = Visit(*I);
4570
4571 return Block;
4572}
4573
4574CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXDeleteExpr(CXXDeleteExpr *DE,
4575 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4576 autoCreateBlock();
4577 appendStmt(Block, DE);
4578 QualType DTy = DE->getDestroyedType();
4579 if (!DTy.isNull()) {
4580 DTy = DTy.getNonReferenceType();
4581 CXXRecordDecl *RD = Context->getBaseElementType(DTy)->getAsCXXRecordDecl();
4582 if (RD) {
4583 if (RD->isCompleteDefinition() && !RD->hasTrivialDestructor())
4584 appendDeleteDtor(Block, RD, DE);
4585 }
4586 }
4587
4588 return VisitChildren(DE);
4589}
4590
4591CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXFunctionalCastExpr(CXXFunctionalCastExpr *E,
4592 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4593 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, E)) {
4594 autoCreateBlock();
4595 appendStmt(Block, E);
4596 // We do not want to propagate the AlwaysAdd property.
4597 asc = asc.withAlwaysAdd(false);
4598 }
4599 return Visit(E->getSubExpr(), asc);
4600}
4601
4602CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXTemporaryObjectExpr(CXXTemporaryObjectExpr *C,
4603 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4604 // If the constructor takes objects as arguments by value, we need to properly
4605 // construct these objects. Construction contexts we find here aren't for the
4606 // constructor C, they're for its arguments only.
4607 findConstructionContextsForArguments(C);
4608
4609 autoCreateBlock();
4610 appendConstructor(Block, C);
4611 return VisitChildren(C);
4612}
4613
4614CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitImplicitCastExpr(ImplicitCastExpr *E,
4615 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4616 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, E)) {
4617 autoCreateBlock();
4618 appendStmt(Block, E);
4619 }
4620
4621 if (E->getCastKind() == CK_IntegralToBoolean)
4622 tryEvaluateBool(E->getSubExpr()->IgnoreParens());
4623
4624 return Visit(E->getSubExpr(), AddStmtChoice());
4625}
4626
4627CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitConstantExpr(ConstantExpr *E, AddStmtChoice asc) {
4628 return Visit(E->getSubExpr(), AddStmtChoice());
4629}
4630
4631CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitIndirectGotoStmt(IndirectGotoStmt *I) {
4632 // Lazily create the indirect-goto dispatch block if there isn't one already.
4633 CFGBlock *IBlock = cfg->getIndirectGotoBlock();
4634
4635 if (!IBlock) {
4636 IBlock = createBlock(false);
4637 cfg->setIndirectGotoBlock(IBlock);
4638 }
4639
4640 // IndirectGoto is a control-flow statement. Thus we stop processing the
4641 // current block and create a new one.
4642 if (badCFG)
4643 return nullptr;
4644
4645 Block = createBlock(false);
4646 Block->setTerminator(I);
4647 addSuccessor(Block, IBlock);
4648 return addStmt(I->getTarget());
4649}
4650
4651CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitForTemporaryDtors(Stmt *E, bool ExternallyDestructed,
4652 TempDtorContext &Context) {
4653 assert(BuildOpts.AddImplicitDtors && BuildOpts.AddTemporaryDtors);
4654
4655tryAgain:
4656 if (!E) {
4657 badCFG = true;
4658 return nullptr;
4659 }
4660 switch (E->getStmtClass()) {
4661 default:
4662 return VisitChildrenForTemporaryDtors(E, false, Context);
4663
4664 case Stmt::InitListExprClass:
4665 return VisitChildrenForTemporaryDtors(E, ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4666
4667 case Stmt::BinaryOperatorClass:
4668 return VisitBinaryOperatorForTemporaryDtors(cast<BinaryOperator>(E),
4669 ExternallyDestructed,
4670 Context);
4671
4672 case Stmt::CXXBindTemporaryExprClass:
4673 return VisitCXXBindTemporaryExprForTemporaryDtors(
4674 cast<CXXBindTemporaryExpr>(E), ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4675
4676 case Stmt::BinaryConditionalOperatorClass:
4677 case Stmt::ConditionalOperatorClass:
4678 return VisitConditionalOperatorForTemporaryDtors(
4679 cast<AbstractConditionalOperator>(E), ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4680
4681 case Stmt::ImplicitCastExprClass:
4682 // For implicit cast we want ExternallyDestructed to be passed further.
4683 E = cast<CastExpr>(E)->getSubExpr();
4684 goto tryAgain;
4685
4686 case Stmt::CXXFunctionalCastExprClass:
4687 // For functional cast we want ExternallyDestructed to be passed further.
4688 E = cast<CXXFunctionalCastExpr>(E)->getSubExpr();
4689 goto tryAgain;
4690
4691 case Stmt::ConstantExprClass:
4692 E = cast<ConstantExpr>(E)->getSubExpr();
4693 goto tryAgain;
4694
4695 case Stmt::ParenExprClass:
4696 E = cast<ParenExpr>(E)->getSubExpr();
4697 goto tryAgain;
4698
4699 case Stmt::MaterializeTemporaryExprClass: {
4700 const MaterializeTemporaryExpr* MTE = cast<MaterializeTemporaryExpr>(E);
4701 ExternallyDestructed = (MTE->getStorageDuration() != SD_FullExpression);
4702 SmallVector<const Expr *, 2> CommaLHSs;
4703 SmallVector<SubobjectAdjustment, 2> Adjustments;
4704 // Find the expression whose lifetime needs to be extended.
4705 E = const_cast<Expr *>(
4706 cast<MaterializeTemporaryExpr>(E)
4707 ->getSubExpr()
4708 ->skipRValueSubobjectAdjustments(CommaLHSs, Adjustments));
4709 // Visit the skipped comma operator left-hand sides for other temporaries.
4710 for (const Expr *CommaLHS : CommaLHSs) {
4711 VisitForTemporaryDtors(const_cast<Expr *>(CommaLHS),
4712 /*ExternallyDestructed=*/false, Context);
4713 }
4714 goto tryAgain;
4715 }
4716
4717 case Stmt::BlockExprClass:
4718 // Don't recurse into blocks; their subexpressions don't get evaluated
4719 // here.
4720 return Block;
4721
4722 case Stmt::LambdaExprClass: {
4723 // For lambda expressions, only recurse into the capture initializers,
4724 // and not the body.
4725 auto *LE = cast<LambdaExpr>(E);
4726 CFGBlock *B = Block;
4727 for (Expr *Init : LE->capture_inits()) {
4728 if (Init) {
4729 if (CFGBlock *R = VisitForTemporaryDtors(
4730 Init, /*ExternallyDestructed=*/true, Context))
4731 B = R;
4732 }
4733 }
4734 return B;
4735 }
4736
4737 case Stmt::StmtExprClass:
4738 // Don't recurse into statement expressions; any cleanups inside them
4739 // will be wrapped in their own ExprWithCleanups.
4740 return Block;
4741
4742 case Stmt::CXXDefaultArgExprClass:
4743 E = cast<CXXDefaultArgExpr>(E)->getExpr();
4744 goto tryAgain;
4745
4746 case Stmt::CXXDefaultInitExprClass:
4747 E = cast<CXXDefaultInitExpr>(E)->getExpr();
4748 goto tryAgain;
4749 }
4750}
4751
4752CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitChildrenForTemporaryDtors(Stmt *E,
4753 bool ExternallyDestructed,
4754 TempDtorContext &Context) {
4755 if (isa<LambdaExpr>(E)) {
4756 // Do not visit the children of lambdas; they have their own CFGs.
4757 return Block;
4758 }
4759
4760 // When visiting children for destructors we want to visit them in reverse
4761 // order that they will appear in the CFG. Because the CFG is built
4762 // bottom-up, this means we visit them in their natural order, which
4763 // reverses them in the CFG.
4764 CFGBlock *B = Block;
4765 for (Stmt *Child : E->children())
4766 if (Child)
4767 if (CFGBlock *R = VisitForTemporaryDtors(Child, ExternallyDestructed, Context))
4768 B = R;
4769
4770 return B;
4771}
4772
4773CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitBinaryOperatorForTemporaryDtors(
4774 BinaryOperator *E, bool ExternallyDestructed, TempDtorContext &Context) {
4775 if (E->isCommaOp()) {
4776 // For the comma operator, the LHS expression is evaluated before the RHS
4777 // expression, so prepend temporary destructors for the LHS first.
4778 CFGBlock *LHSBlock = VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getLHS(), false, Context);
4779 CFGBlock *RHSBlock = VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getRHS(), ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4780 return RHSBlock ? RHSBlock : LHSBlock;
4781 }
4782
4783 if (E->isLogicalOp()) {
4784 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getLHS(), false, Context);
4785 TryResult RHSExecuted = tryEvaluateBool(E->getLHS());
4786 if (RHSExecuted.isKnown() && E->getOpcode() == BO_LOr)
4787 RHSExecuted.negate();
4788
4789 // We do not know at CFG-construction time whether the right-hand-side was
4790 // executed, thus we add a branch node that depends on the temporary
4791 // constructor call.
4792 TempDtorContext RHSContext(
4793 bothKnownTrue(Context.KnownExecuted, RHSExecuted));
4794 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getRHS(), false, RHSContext);
4795 InsertTempDtorDecisionBlock(RHSContext);
4796
4797 return Block;
4798 }
4799
4800 if (E->isAssignmentOp()) {
4801 // For assignment operators, the RHS expression is evaluated before the LHS
4802 // expression, so prepend temporary destructors for the RHS first.
4803 CFGBlock *RHSBlock = VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getRHS(), false, Context);
4804 CFGBlock *LHSBlock = VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getLHS(), false, Context);
4805 return LHSBlock ? LHSBlock : RHSBlock;
4806 }
4807
4808 // Any other operator is visited normally.
4809 return VisitChildrenForTemporaryDtors(E, ExternallyDestructed, Context);
4810}
4811
4812CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitCXXBindTemporaryExprForTemporaryDtors(
4813 CXXBindTemporaryExpr *E, bool ExternallyDestructed, TempDtorContext &Context) {
4814 // First add destructors for temporaries in subexpression.
4815 // Because VisitCXXBindTemporaryExpr calls setDestructed:
4816 CFGBlock *B = VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getSubExpr(), true, Context);
4817 if (!ExternallyDestructed) {
4818 // If lifetime of temporary is not prolonged (by assigning to constant
4819 // reference) add destructor for it.
4820
4821 const CXXDestructorDecl *Dtor = E->getTemporary()->getDestructor();
4822
4823 if (Dtor->getParent()->isAnyDestructorNoReturn()) {
4824 // If the destructor is marked as a no-return destructor, we need to
4825 // create a new block for the destructor which does not have as a
4826 // successor anything built thus far. Control won't flow out of this
4827 // block.
4828 if (B) Succ = B;
4829 Block = createNoReturnBlock();
4830 } else if (Context.needsTempDtorBranch()) {
4831 // If we need to introduce a branch, we add a new block that we will hook
4832 // up to a decision block later.
4833 if (B) Succ = B;
4834 Block = createBlock();
4835 } else {
4836 autoCreateBlock();
4837 }
4838 if (Context.needsTempDtorBranch()) {
4839 Context.setDecisionPoint(Succ, E);
4840 }
4841 appendTemporaryDtor(Block, E);
4842
4843 B = Block;
4844 }
4845 return B;
4846}
4847
4848void CFGBuilder::InsertTempDtorDecisionBlock(const TempDtorContext &Context,
4849 CFGBlock *FalseSucc) {
4850 if (!Context.TerminatorExpr) {
4851 // If no temporary was found, we do not need to insert a decision point.
4852 return;
4853 }
4854 assert(Context.TerminatorExpr);
4855 CFGBlock *Decision = createBlock(false);
4856 Decision->setTerminator(CFGTerminator(Context.TerminatorExpr,
4857 CFGTerminator::TemporaryDtorsBranch));
4858 addSuccessor(Decision, Block, !Context.KnownExecuted.isFalse());
4859 addSuccessor(Decision, FalseSucc ? FalseSucc : Context.Succ,
4860 !Context.KnownExecuted.isTrue());
4861 Block = Decision;
4862}
4863
4864CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitConditionalOperatorForTemporaryDtors(
4865 AbstractConditionalOperator *E, bool ExternallyDestructed,
4866 TempDtorContext &Context) {
4867 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getCond(), false, Context);
4868 CFGBlock *ConditionBlock = Block;
4869 CFGBlock *ConditionSucc = Succ;
4870 TryResult ConditionVal = tryEvaluateBool(E->getCond());
4871 TryResult NegatedVal = ConditionVal;
4872 if (NegatedVal.isKnown()) NegatedVal.negate();
4873
4874 TempDtorContext TrueContext(
4875 bothKnownTrue(Context.KnownExecuted, ConditionVal));
4876 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getTrueExpr(), ExternallyDestructed, TrueContext);
4877 CFGBlock *TrueBlock = Block;
4878
4879 Block = ConditionBlock;
4880 Succ = ConditionSucc;
4881 TempDtorContext FalseContext(
4882 bothKnownTrue(Context.KnownExecuted, NegatedVal));
4883 VisitForTemporaryDtors(E->getFalseExpr(), ExternallyDestructed, FalseContext);
4884
4885 if (TrueContext.TerminatorExpr && FalseContext.TerminatorExpr) {
4886 InsertTempDtorDecisionBlock(FalseContext, TrueBlock);
4887 } else if (TrueContext.TerminatorExpr) {
4888 Block = TrueBlock;
4889 InsertTempDtorDecisionBlock(TrueContext);
4890 } else {
4891 InsertTempDtorDecisionBlock(FalseContext);
4892 }
4893 return Block;
4894}
4895
4896CFGBlock *CFGBuilder::VisitOMPExecutableDirective(OMPExecutableDirective *D,
4897 AddStmtChoice asc) {
4898 if (asc.alwaysAdd(*this, D)) {
4899 autoCreateBlock();
4900 appendStmt(Block, D);
4901 }
4902
4903 // Iterate over all used expression in clauses.
4904 CFGBlock *B = Block;
4905
4906 // Reverse the elements to process them in natural order. Iterators are not
4907 // bidirectional, so we need to create temp vector.
4908 SmallVector<Stmt *, 8> Used(
4909 OMPExecutableDirective::used_clauses_children(D->clauses()));
4910 for (Stmt *S : llvm::reverse(Used)) {
4911 assert(S && "Expected non-null used-in-clause child.");
4912 if (CFGBlock *R = Visit(S))
4913 B = R;
4914 }
4915 // Visit associated structured block if any.
4916 if (!D->isStandaloneDirective()) {
4917 Stmt *S = D->getRawStmt();
4918 if (!isa<CompoundStmt>(S))
4919 addLocalScopeAndDtors(S);
4920 if (CFGBlock *R = addStmt(S))
4921 B = R;
4922 }
4923
4924 return B;
4925}
4926
4927/// createBlock - Constructs and adds a new CFGBlock to the CFG. The block has
4928/// no successors or predecessors. If this is the first block created in the
4929/// CFG, it is automatically set to be the Entry and Exit of the CFG.
4930CFGBlock *CFG::createBlock() {
4931 bool first_block = begin() == end();
4932
4933 // Create the block.
4934 CFGBlock *Mem = getAllocator().Allocate<CFGBlock>();
4935 new (Mem) CFGBlock(NumBlockIDs++, BlkBVC, this);
4936 Blocks.push_back(Mem, BlkBVC);
4937
4938 // If this is the first block, set it as the Entry and Exit.
4939 if (first_block)
4940 Entry = Exit = &back();
4941
4942 // Return the block.
4943 return &back();
4944}
4945
4946/// buildCFG - Constructs a CFG from an AST.
4947std::unique_ptr<CFG> CFG::buildCFG(const Decl *D, Stmt *Statement,
4948 ASTContext *C, const BuildOptions &BO) {
4949 CFGBuilder Builder(C, BO);
4950 return Builder.buildCFG(D, Statement);
4951}
4952
4953bool CFG::isLinear() const {
4954 // Quick path: if we only have the ENTRY block, the EXIT block, and some code
4955 // in between, then we have no room for control flow.
4956 if (size() <= 3)
4957 return true;
4958
4959 // Traverse the CFG until we find a branch.
4960 // TODO: While this should still be very fast,
4961 // maybe we should cache the answer.
4962 llvm::SmallPtrSet<const CFGBlock *, 4> Visited;
4963 const CFGBlock *B = Entry;
4964 while (B != Exit) {
4965 auto IteratorAndFlag = Visited.insert(B);
4966 if (!IteratorAndFlag.second) {
4967 // We looped back to a block that we've already visited. Not linear.
4968 return false;
4969 }
4970
4971 // Iterate over reachable successors.
4972 const CFGBlock *FirstReachableB = nullptr;
4973 for (const CFGBlock::AdjacentBlock &AB : B->succs()) {
4974 if (!AB.isReachable())
4975 continue;
4976
4977 if (FirstReachableB == nullptr) {
4978 FirstReachableB = &*AB;
4979 } else {
4980 // We've encountered a branch. It's not a linear CFG.
4981 return false;
4982 }
4983 }
4984
4985 if (!FirstReachableB) {
4986 // We reached a dead end. EXIT is unreachable. This is linear enough.
4987 return true;
4988 }
4989
4990 // There's only one way to move forward. Proceed.
4991 B = FirstReachableB;
4992 }
4993
4994 // We reached EXIT and found no branches.
4995 return true;
4996}
4997
4998const CXXDestructorDecl *
4999CFGImplicitDtor::getDestructorDecl(ASTContext &astContext) const {
5000 switch (getKind()) {
5001 case CFGElement::Initializer:
5002 case CFGElement::NewAllocator:
5003 case CFGElement::LoopExit:
5004 case CFGElement::LifetimeEnds:
5005 case CFGElement::Statement:
5006 case CFGElement::Constructor:
5007 case CFGElement::CXXRecordTypedCall:
5008 case CFGElement::ScopeBegin:
5009 case CFGElement::ScopeEnd:
5010 llvm_unreachable("getDestructorDecl should only be used with "
5011 "ImplicitDtors");
5012 case CFGElement::AutomaticObjectDtor: {
5013 const VarDecl *var = castAs<CFGAutomaticObjDtor>().getVarDecl();
5014 QualType ty = var->getType();
5015
5016 // FIXME: See CFGBuilder::addLocalScopeForVarDecl.
5017 //
5018 // Lifetime-extending constructs are handled here. This works for a single
5019 // temporary in an initializer expression.
5020 if (ty->isReferenceType()) {
5021 if (const Expr *Init = var->getInit()) {
5022 ty = getReferenceInitTemporaryType(Init);
5023 }
5024 }
5025
5026 while (const ArrayType *arrayType = astContext.getAsArrayType(ty)) {
5027 ty = arrayType->getElementType();
5028 }
5029
5030 // The situation when the type of the lifetime-extending reference
5031 // does not correspond to the type of the object is supposed
5032 // to be handled by now. In particular, 'ty' is now the unwrapped
5033 // record type.
5034 const CXXRecordDecl *classDecl = ty->getAsCXXRecordDecl();
5035 assert(classDecl);
5036 return classDecl->getDestructor();
5037 }
5038 case CFGElement::DeleteDtor: {
5039 const CXXDeleteExpr *DE = castAs<CFGDeleteDtor>().getDeleteExpr();
5040 QualType DTy = DE->getDestroyedType();
5041 DTy = DTy.getNonReferenceType();
5042 const CXXRecordDecl *classDecl =
5043 astContext.getBaseElementType(DTy)->getAsCXXRecordDecl();
5044 return classDecl->getDestructor();
5045 }
5046 case CFGElement::TemporaryDtor: {
5047 const CXXBindTemporaryExpr *bindExpr =
5048 castAs<CFGTemporaryDtor>().getBindTemporaryExpr();
5049 const CXXTemporary *temp = bindExpr->getTemporary();
5050 return temp->getDestructor();
5051 }
5052 case CFGElement::BaseDtor:
5053 case CFGElement::MemberDtor:
5054 // Not yet supported.
5055 return nullptr;
5056 }
5057 llvm_unreachable("getKind() returned bogus value");
5058}
5059
5060//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
5061// CFGBlock operations.
5062//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
5063
5064CFGBlock::AdjacentBlock::AdjacentBlock(CFGBlock *B, bool IsReachable)
5065 : ReachableBlock(IsReachable ? B : nullptr),
5066 UnreachableBlock(!IsReachable ? B : nullptr,
5067 B && IsReachable ? AB_Normal : AB_Unreachable) {}
5068
5069CFGBlock::AdjacentBlock::AdjacentBlock(CFGBlock *B, CFGBlock *AlternateBlock)
5070 : ReachableBlock(B),
5071 UnreachableBlock(B == AlternateBlock ? nullptr : AlternateBlock,
5072 B == AlternateBlock ? AB_Alternate : AB_Normal) {}
5073
5074void CFGBlock::addSuccessor(AdjacentBlock Succ,
5075 BumpVectorContext &C) {
5076 if (CFGBlock *B = Succ.getReachableBlock())
5077 B->Preds.push_back(AdjacentBlock(this, Succ.isReachable()), C);
5078
5079 if (CFGBlock *UnreachableB = Succ.getPossiblyUnreachableBlock())
5080 UnreachableB->Preds.push_back(AdjacentBlock(this, false), C);
5081
5082 Succs.push_back(Succ, C);
5083}
5084
5085bool CFGBlock::FilterEdge(const CFGBlock::FilterOptions &F,
5086 const CFGBlock *From, const CFGBlock *To) {
5087 if (F.IgnoreNullPredecessors && !From)
5088 return true;
5089
5090 if (To && From && F.IgnoreDefaultsWithCoveredEnums) {
5091 // If the 'To' has no label or is labeled but the label isn't a
5092 // CaseStmt then filter this edge.
5093 if (const SwitchStmt *S =
5094 dyn_cast_or_null<SwitchStmt>(From->getTerminatorStmt())) {
5095 if (S->isAllEnumCasesCovered()) {
5096 const Stmt *L = To->getLabel();
5097 if (!L || !isa<CaseStmt>(L))
5098 return true;
5099 }
5100 }
5101 }
5102
5103 return false;
5104}

5106//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
5107// CFG pretty printing
5108//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
5109
5110namespace {
5111
5112class StmtPrinterHelper : public PrinterHelper {
5113 using StmtMapTy = llvm::DenseMap<const Stmt *, std::pair<unsigned, unsigned>>;
5114 using DeclMapTy = llvm::DenseMap<const Decl *, std::pair<unsigned, unsigned>>;
5115
5116 StmtMapTy StmtMap;
5117 DeclMapTy DeclMap;
5118 signed currentBlock = 0;
5119 unsigned currStmt = 0;
5120 const LangOptions &LangOpts;
5121
5122public:
5123 StmtPrinterHelper(const CFG* cfg, const LangOptions &LO)
5124 : LangOpts(LO) {
5125 if (!cfg)
5126 return;
5127 for (CFG::const_iterator I = cfg->begin(), E = cfg->end(); I != E; ++I ) {
5128 unsigned j = 1;
5129 for (CFGBlock::const_iterator BI = (*I)->begin(), BEnd = (*I)->end() ;
5130 BI != BEnd; ++BI, ++j ) {
5131 if (Optional<CFGStmt> SE = BI->getAs<CFGStmt>()) {
5132 const Stmt *stmt= SE->getStmt();
5133 std::pair<unsigned, unsigned> P((*I)->getBlockID(), j);
5134 StmtMap[stmt] = P;
5135
5136 switch (stmt->getStmtClass()) {
5137 case Stmt::DeclStmtClass:
5138 DeclMap[cast<DeclStmt>(stmt)->getSingleDecl()] = P;
5139 break;
5140 case Stmt::IfStmtClass: {
5141 const VarDecl *var = cast<IfStmt>(stmt)->getConditionVariable();
5142 if (var)
5143 DeclMap[var] = P;
5144 break;
5145 }
5146 case Stmt::ForStmtClass: {
5147 const VarDecl *var = cast<ForStmt>(stmt)->getConditionVariable();
5148 if (var)
5149 DeclMap[var] = P;
5150 break;
5151 }
5152 case Stmt::WhileStmtClass: {
5153 const VarDecl *var =
5154 cast<WhileStmt>(stmt)->getConditionVariable();
5155 if (var)
5156 DeclMap[var] = P;
5157 break;
5158 }
5159 case Stmt::SwitchStmtClass: {
5160 const VarDecl *var =
5161 cast<SwitchStmt>(stmt)->getConditionVariable();
5162 if (var)
5163 DeclMap[var] = P;
5164 break;
5165 }
5166 case Stmt::CXXCatchStmtClass: {
5167 const VarDecl *var =
5168 cast<CXXCatchStmt>(stmt)->getExceptionDecl();
5169 if (var)
5170 DeclMap[var] = P;
5171 break;
5172 }
5173 default:
5174 break;
5175 }
5176 }
5177 }
5178 }
5179 }
5180
5181 ~StmtPrinterHelper() override = default;
5182
5183 const LangOptions &getLangOpts() const { return LangOpts; }
5184 void setBlockID(signed i) { currentBlock = i; }
5185 void setStmtID(unsigned i) { currStmt = i; }
5186
5187 bool handledStmt(Stmt *S, raw_ostream &OS) override {
5188 StmtMapTy::iterator I = StmtMap.find(S);
5189
5190 if (I == StmtMap.end())
5191 return false;
5192
5193 if (currentBlock >= 0 && I->second.first == (unsigned) currentBlock
5194 && I->second.second == currStmt) {
5195 return false;
5196 }
5197
5198 OS << "[B" << I->second.first << "." << I->second.second << "]";
5199 return true;
5200 }
5201
5202 bool handleDecl(const Decl *D, raw_ostream &OS) {
5203 DeclMapTy::iterator I = DeclMap.find(D);
5204
5205 if (I == DeclMap.end())
5206 return false;
5207
5208 if (currentBlock >= 0 && I->second.first == (unsigned) currentBlock
5209 && I->second.second == currStmt) {
5210 return false;
5211 }
5212
5213 OS << "[B" << I->second.first << "." << I->second.second << "]";
5214 return true;
5215 }
5216};
5217
5218class CFGBlockTerminatorPrint
5219 : public StmtVisitor<CFGBlockTerminatorPrint,void> {
5220 raw_ostream &OS;
5221 StmtPrinterHelper* Helper;
5222 PrintingPolicy Policy;
5223
5224public:
5225 CFGBlockTerminatorPrint(raw_ostream &os, StmtPrinterHelper* helper,
5226 const PrintingPolicy &Policy)
5227 : OS(os), Helper(helper), Policy(Policy) {
5228 this->Policy.IncludeNewlines = false;
5229 }
5230
5231 void VisitIfStmt(IfStmt *I) {
5232 OS << "if ";
5233 if (Stmt *C = I->getCond())
5234 C->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5235 }
5236
5237 // Default case.
5238 void VisitStmt(Stmt *Terminator) {
5239 Terminator->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5240 }
5241
5242 void VisitDeclStmt(DeclStmt *DS) {
5243 VarDecl *VD = cast<VarDecl>(DS->getSingleDecl());
5244 OS << "static init " << VD->getName();
5245 }
5246
5247 void VisitForStmt(ForStmt *F) {
5248 OS << "for (" ;
5249 if (F->getInit())
5250 OS << "...";
5251 OS << "; ";
5252 if (Stmt *C = F->getCond())
5253 C->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5254 OS << "; ";
5255 if (F->getInc())
5256 OS << "...";
5257 OS << ")";
5258 }
5259
5260 void VisitWhileStmt(WhileStmt *W) {
5261 OS << "while " ;
5262 if (Stmt *C = W->getCond())
5263 C->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5264 }
5265
5266 void VisitDoStmt(DoStmt *D) {
5267 OS << "do ... while ";
5268 if (Stmt *C = D->getCond())
5269 C->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5270 }
5271
5272 void VisitSwitchStmt(SwitchStmt *Terminator) {
5273 OS << "switch ";
5274 Terminator->getCond()->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5275 }
5276
5277 void VisitCXXTryStmt(CXXTryStmt *CS) {
5278 OS << "try ...";
5279 }
5280
5281 void VisitSEHTryStmt(SEHTryStmt *CS) {
5282 OS << "__try ...";
5283 }
5284
5285 void VisitAbstractConditionalOperator(AbstractConditionalOperator* C) {
5286 if (Stmt *Cond = C->getCond())
5287 Cond->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5288 OS << " ? ... : ...";
5289 }
5290
5291 void VisitChooseExpr(ChooseExpr *C) {
5292 OS << "__builtin_choose_expr( ";
5293 if (Stmt *Cond = C->getCond())
5294 Cond->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5295 OS << " )";
5296 }
5297
5298 void VisitIndirectGotoStmt(IndirectGotoStmt *I) {
5299 OS << "goto *";
5300 if (Stmt *T = I->getTarget())
5301 T->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5302 }
5303
5304 void VisitBinaryOperator(BinaryOperator* B) {
5305 if (!B->isLogicalOp()) {
5306 VisitExpr(B);
5307 return;
5308 }
5309
5310 if (B->getLHS())
5311 B->getLHS()->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5312
5313 switch (B->getOpcode()) {
5314 case BO_LOr:
5315 OS << " || ...";
5316 return;
5317 case BO_LAnd:
5318 OS << " && ...";
5319 return;
5320 default:
5321 llvm_unreachable("Invalid logical operator.");
5322 }
5323 }
5324
5325 void VisitExpr(Expr *E) {
5326 E->printPretty(OS, Helper, Policy);
5327 }
5328
5329public:
5330 void print(CFGTerminator T) {
5331 switch (T.getKind()) {
5332 case CFGTerminator::StmtBranch:
5333 Visit(T.getStmt());
5334 break;
5335 case CFGTerminator::TemporaryDtorsBranch:
5336 OS << "(Temp Dtor) ";
5337 Visit(T.getStmt());
5338 break;
5339 case CFGTerminator::VirtualBaseBranch:
5340 OS << "(See if most derived ctor has already initialized vbases)";
5341 break;
5342 }
5343 }
5344};
5345
5346} // namespace
5347
5348static void print_initializer(raw_ostream &OS, StmtPrinterHelper &Helper,
5349 const CXXCtorInitializer *I) {
5350 if (I->isBaseInitializer())
5351 OS << I->getBaseClass()->getAsCXXRecordDecl()->getName();
5352 else if (I->isDelegatingInitializer())
5353 OS << I->getTypeSourceInfo()->getType()->getAsCXXRecordDecl()->getName();
5354 else
5355 OS << I->getAnyMember()->getName();
5356 OS << "(";
5357 if (Expr *IE = I->getInit())
5358 IE->printPretty(OS, &Helper, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5359 OS << ")";
5360
5361 if (I->isBaseInitializer())
5362 OS << " (Base initializer)";
5363 else if (I->isDelegatingInitializer())
5364 OS << " (Delegating initializer)";
5365 else
5366 OS << " (Member initializer)";
5367}
5368
5369static void print_construction_context(raw_ostream &OS,
5370 StmtPrinterHelper &Helper,
5371 const ConstructionContext *CC) {
5372 SmallVector<const Stmt *, 3> Stmts;
5373 switch (CC->getKind()) {
5374 case ConstructionContext::SimpleConstructorInitializerKind: {
5375 OS << ", ";
5376 const auto *SICC = cast<SimpleConstructorInitializerConstructionContext>(CC);
5377 print_initializer(OS, Helper, SICC->getCXXCtorInitializer());
5378 return;
5379 }
5380 case ConstructionContext::CXX17ElidedCopyConstructorInitializerKind: {
5381 OS << ", ";
5382 const auto *CICC =
5383 cast<CXX17ElidedCopyConstructorInitializerConstructionContext>(CC);
5384 print_initializer(OS, Helper, CICC->getCXXCtorInitializer());
5385 Stmts.push_back(CICC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr());
5386 break;
5387 }
5388 case ConstructionContext::SimpleVariableKind: {
5389 const auto *SDSCC = cast<SimpleVariableConstructionContext>(CC);
5390 Stmts.push_back(SDSCC->getDeclStmt());
5391 break;
5392 }
5393 case ConstructionContext::CXX17ElidedCopyVariableKind: {
5394 const auto *CDSCC = cast<CXX17ElidedCopyVariableConstructionContext>(CC);
5395 Stmts.push_back(CDSCC->getDeclStmt());
5396 Stmts.push_back(CDSCC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr());
5397 break;
5398 }
5399 case ConstructionContext::NewAllocatedObjectKind: {
5400 const auto *NECC = cast<NewAllocatedObjectConstructionContext>(CC);
5401 Stmts.push_back(NECC->getCXXNewExpr());
5402 break;
5403 }
5404 case ConstructionContext::SimpleReturnedValueKind: {
5405 const auto *RSCC = cast<SimpleReturnedValueConstructionContext>(CC);
5406 Stmts.push_back(RSCC->getReturnStmt());
5407 break;
5408 }
5409 case ConstructionContext::CXX17ElidedCopyReturnedValueKind: {
5410 const auto *RSCC =
5411 cast<CXX17ElidedCopyReturnedValueConstructionContext>(CC);
5412 Stmts.push_back(RSCC->getReturnStmt());
5413 Stmts.push_back(RSCC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr());
5414 break;
5415 }
5416 case ConstructionContext::SimpleTemporaryObjectKind: {
5417 const auto *TOCC = cast<SimpleTemporaryObjectConstructionContext>(CC);
5418 Stmts.push_back(TOCC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr());
5419 Stmts.push_back(TOCC->getMaterializedTemporaryExpr());
5420 break;
5421 }
5422 case ConstructionContext::ElidedTemporaryObjectKind: {
5423 const auto *TOCC = cast<ElidedTemporaryObjectConstructionContext>(CC);
5424 Stmts.push_back(TOCC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr());
5425 Stmts.push_back(TOCC->getMaterializedTemporaryExpr());
5426 Stmts.push_back(TOCC->getConstructorAfterElision());
5427 break;
5428 }
5429 case ConstructionContext::ArgumentKind: {
5430 const auto *ACC = cast<ArgumentConstructionContext>(CC);
5431 if (const Stmt *BTE = ACC->getCXXBindTemporaryExpr()) {
5432 OS << ", ";
5433 Helper.handledStmt(const_cast<Stmt *>(BTE), OS);
5434 }
5435 OS << ", ";
5436 Helper.handledStmt(const_cast<Expr *>(ACC->getCallLikeExpr()), OS);
5437 OS << "+" << ACC->getIndex();
5438 return;
5439 }
5440 }
5441 for (auto I: Stmts)
5442 if (I) {
5443 OS << ", ";
5444 Helper.handledStmt(const_cast<Stmt *>(I), OS);
5445 }
5446}
5447
5448static void print_elem(raw_ostream &OS, StmtPrinterHelper &Helper,
5449 const CFGElement &E);
5450
5451void CFGElement::dumpToStream(llvm::raw_ostream &OS) const {
5452 StmtPrinterHelper Helper(nullptr, {});
5453 print_elem(OS, Helper, *this);
5454}
5455
5456static void print_elem(raw_ostream &OS, StmtPrinterHelper &Helper,
5457 const CFGElement &E) {
5458 switch (E.getKind()) {
5459 case CFGElement::Kind::Statement:
5460 case CFGElement::Kind::CXXRecordTypedCall:
5461 case CFGElement::Kind::Constructor: {
5462 CFGStmt CS = E.castAs<CFGStmt>();
5463 const Stmt *S = CS.getStmt();
5464 assert(S != nullptr && "Expecting non-null Stmt");
5465
5466 // special printing for statement-expressions.
5467 if (const StmtExpr *SE = dyn_cast<StmtExpr>(S)) {
5468 const CompoundStmt *Sub = SE->getSubStmt();
5469
5470 auto Children = Sub->children();
5471 if (Children.begin() != Children.end()) {
5472 OS << "({ ... ; ";
5473 Helper.handledStmt(*SE->getSubStmt()->body_rbegin(),OS);
5474 OS << " })\n";
5475 return;
5476 }
5477 }
5478 // special printing for comma expressions.
5479 if (const BinaryOperator* B = dyn_cast<BinaryOperator>(S)) {
5480 if (B->getOpcode() == BO_Comma) {
5481 OS << "... , ";
5482 Helper.handledStmt(B->getRHS(),OS);
5483 OS << '\n';
5484 return;
5485 }
5486 }
5487 S->printPretty(OS, &Helper, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5488
5489 if (auto VTC = E.getAs<CFGCXXRecordTypedCall>()) {
5490 if (isa<CXXOperatorCallExpr>(S))
5491 OS << " (OperatorCall)";
5492 OS << " (CXXRecordTypedCall";
5493 print_construction_context(OS, Helper, VTC->getConstructionContext());
5494 OS << ")";
5495 } else if (isa<CXXOperatorCallExpr>(S)) {
5496 OS << " (OperatorCall)";
5497 } else if (isa<CXXBindTemporaryExpr>(S)) {
5498 OS << " (BindTemporary)";
5499 } else if (const CXXConstructExpr *CCE = dyn_cast<CXXConstructExpr>(S)) {
5500 OS << " (CXXConstructExpr";
5501 if (Optional<CFGConstructor> CE = E.getAs<CFGConstructor>()) {
5502 print_construction_context(OS, Helper, CE->getConstructionContext());
5503 }
5504 OS << ", " << CCE->getType().getAsString() << ")";
5505 } else if (const CastExpr *CE = dyn_cast<CastExpr>(S)) {
5506 OS << " (" << CE->getStmtClassName() << ", "
5507 << CE->getCastKindName()
5508 << ", " << CE->getType().getAsString()
5509 << ")";
5510 }
5511
5512 // Expressions need a newline.
5513 if (isa<Expr>(S))
5514 OS << '\n';
5515
5516 break;
5517 }
5518
5519 case CFGElement::Kind::Initializer:
5520 print_initializer(OS, Helper, E.castAs<CFGInitializer>().getInitializer());
5521 OS << '\n';
5522 break;
5523
5524 case CFGElement::Kind::AutomaticObjectDtor: {
5525 CFGAutomaticObjDtor DE = E.castAs<CFGAutomaticObjDtor>();
5526 const VarDecl *VD = DE.getVarDecl();
5527 Helper.handleDecl(VD, OS);
5528
5529 QualType T = VD->getType();
5530 if (T->isReferenceType())
5531 T = getReferenceInitTemporaryType(VD->getInit(), nullptr);
5532
5533 OS << ".~";
5534 T.getUnqualifiedType().print(OS, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5535 OS << "() (Implicit destructor)\n";
5536 break;
5537 }
5538
5539 case CFGElement::Kind::LifetimeEnds:
5540 Helper.handleDecl(E.castAs<CFGLifetimeEnds>().getVarDecl(), OS);
5541 OS << " (Lifetime ends)\n";
5542 break;
5543
5544 case CFGElement::Kind::LoopExit:
5545 OS << E.castAs<CFGLoopExit>().getLoopStmt()->getStmtClassName() << " (LoopExit)\n";
5546 break;
5547
5548 case CFGElement::Kind::ScopeBegin:
5549 OS << "CFGScopeBegin(";
5550 if (const VarDecl *VD = E.castAs<CFGScopeBegin>().getVarDecl())
5551 OS << VD->getQualifiedNameAsString();
5552 OS << ")\n";
5553 break;
5554
5555 case CFGElement::Kind::ScopeEnd:
5556 OS << "CFGScopeEnd(";
5557 if (const VarDecl *VD = E.castAs<CFGScopeEnd>().getVarDecl())
5558 OS << VD->getQualifiedNameAsString();
5559 OS << ")\n";
5560 break;
5561
5562 case CFGElement::Kind::NewAllocator:
5563 OS << "CFGNewAllocator(";
5564 if (const CXXNewExpr *AllocExpr = E.castAs<CFGNewAllocator>().getAllocatorExpr())
5565 AllocExpr->getType().print(OS, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5566 OS << ")\n";
5567 break;
5568
5569 case CFGElement::Kind::DeleteDtor: {
5570 CFGDeleteDtor DE = E.castAs<CFGDeleteDtor>();
5571 const CXXRecordDecl *RD = DE.getCXXRecordDecl();
5572 if (!RD)
5573 return;
5574 CXXDeleteExpr *DelExpr =
5575 const_cast<CXXDeleteExpr*>(DE.getDeleteExpr());
5576 Helper.handledStmt(cast<Stmt>(DelExpr->getArgument()), OS);
5577 OS << "->~" << RD->getName().str() << "()";
5578 OS << " (Implicit destructor)\n";
5579 break;
5580 }
5581
5582 case CFGElement::Kind::BaseDtor: {
5583 const CXXBaseSpecifier *BS = E.castAs<CFGBaseDtor>().getBaseSpecifier();
5584 OS << "~" << BS->getType()->getAsCXXRecordDecl()->getName() << "()";
5585 OS << " (Base object destructor)\n";
5586 break;
5587 }
5588
5589 case CFGElement::Kind::MemberDtor: {
5590 const FieldDecl *FD = E.castAs<CFGMemberDtor>().getFieldDecl();
5591 const Type *T = FD->getType()->getBaseElementTypeUnsafe();
5592 OS << "this->" << FD->getName();
5593 OS << ".~" << T->getAsCXXRecordDecl()->getName() << "()";
5594 OS << " (Member object destructor)\n";
5595 break;
5596 }
5597
5598 case CFGElement::Kind::TemporaryDtor: {
5599 const CXXBindTemporaryExpr *BT = E.castAs<CFGTemporaryDtor>().getBindTemporaryExpr();
5600 OS << "~";
5601 BT->getType().print(OS, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5602 OS << "() (Temporary object destructor)\n";
5603 break;
5604 }
5605 }
5606}
5607
5608static void print_block(raw_ostream &OS, const CFG* cfg,
5609 const CFGBlock &B,
5610 StmtPrinterHelper &Helper, bool print_edges,
5611 bool ShowColors) {
5612 Helper.setBlockID(B.getBlockID());
5613
5614 // Print the header.
5615 if (ShowColors)
5616 OS.changeColor(raw_ostream::YELLOW, true);
5617
5618 OS << "\n [B" << B.getBlockID();
5619
5620 if (&B == &cfg->getEntry())
5621 OS << " (ENTRY)]\n";
5622 else if (&B == &cfg->getExit())
5623 OS << " (EXIT)]\n";
5624 else if (&B == cfg->getIndirectGotoBlock())
5625 OS << " (INDIRECT GOTO DISPATCH)]\n";
5626 else if (B.hasNoReturnElement())
5627 OS << " (NORETURN)]\n";
5628 else
5629 OS << "]\n";
5630
5631 if (ShowColors)
5632 OS.resetColor();
5633
5634 // Print the label of this block.
5635 if (Stmt *Label = const_cast<Stmt*>(B.getLabel())) {
5636 if (print_edges)
5637 OS << " ";
5638
5639 if (LabelStmt *L = dyn_cast<LabelStmt>(Label))
5640 OS << L->getName();
5641 else if (CaseStmt *C = dyn_cast<CaseStmt>(Label)) {
5642 OS << "case ";
5643 if (C->getLHS())
5644 C->getLHS()->printPretty(OS, &Helper,
5645 PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5646 if (C->getRHS()) {
5647 OS << " ... ";
5648 C->getRHS()->printPretty(OS, &Helper,
5649 PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()));
5650 }
5651 } else if (isa<DefaultStmt>(Label))
5652 OS << "default";
5653 else if (CXXCatchStmt *CS = dyn_cast<CXXCatchStmt>(Label)) {
5654 OS << "catch (";
5655 if (CS->getExceptionDecl())
5656 CS->getExceptionDecl()->print(OS, PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()),
5657 0);
5658 else
5659 OS << "...";
5660 OS << ")";
5661 } else if (SEHExceptStmt *ES = dyn_cast<SEHExceptStmt>(Label)) {
5662 OS << "__except (";
5663 ES->getFilterExpr()->printPretty(OS, &Helper,
5664 PrintingPolicy(Helper.getLangOpts()), 0);
5665 OS << ")";
5666 } else
5667 llvm_unreachable("Invalid label statement in CFGBlock.");
5668
5669 OS << ":\n";
5670 }
5671
5672 // Iterate through the statements in the block and print them.
5673 unsigned j = 1;
5674
5675 for (CFGBlock::const_iterator I = B.begin(), E = B.end() ;
5676 I != E ; ++I, ++j ) {
5677 // Print the statement # in the basic block and the statement itself.
5678 if (print_edges)
5679 OS << " ";
5680
5681 OS << llvm::format("%3d", j) << ": ";
5682
5683 Helper.setStmtID(j);
5684
5685 print_elem(OS, Helper, *I);
5686 }
5687
5688 // Print the terminator of this block.
5689 if (B.getTerminator().isValid()) {
5690 if (ShowColors)
5691 OS.changeColor(raw_ostream::GREEN);
5692
5693 OS << " T: ";
5694
5695 Helper.setBlockID(-1);
5696
5697 PrintingPolicy PP(Helper.getLangOpts());
5698 CFGBlockTerminatorPrint TPrinter(OS, &Helper, PP);
5699 TPrinter.print(B.getTerminator());
5700 OS << '\n';
5701
5702 if (ShowColors)
5703 OS.resetColor();
5704 }
5705
5706 if (print_edges) {
5707 // Print the predecessors of this block.
5708 if (!B.pred_empty()) {
5709 const raw_ostream::Colors Color = raw_ostream::BLUE;
5710 if (ShowColors)
5711 OS.changeColor(Color);
5712 OS << " Preds " ;
5713 if (ShowColors)
5714 OS.resetColor();
5715 OS << '(' << B.pred_size() << "):";
5716 unsigned i = 0;
5717
5718 if (ShowColors)
5719 OS.changeColor(Color);
5720
5721 for (CFGBlock::const_pred_iterator I = B.pred_begin(), E = B.pred_end();
5722 I != E; ++I, ++i) {
5723 if (i % 10 == 8)
5724 OS << "\n ";
5725
5726 CFGBlock *B = *I;
5727 bool Reachable = true;
5728 if (!B) {
5729 Reachable = false;
5730 B = I->getPossiblyUnreachableBlock();
5731 }
5732
5733 OS << " B" << B->getBlockID();
5734 if (!Reachable)
5735 OS << "(Unreachable)";
5736 }
5737
5738 if (ShowColors)
5739 OS.resetColor();
5740
5741 OS << '\n';
5742 }
5743
5744 // Print the successors of this block.
5745 if (!B.succ_empty()) {
5746 const raw_ostream::Colors Color = raw_ostream::MAGENTA;
5747 if (ShowColors)
5748 OS.changeColor(Color);
5749 OS << " Succs ";
5750 if (ShowColors)
5751 OS.resetColor();
5752 OS << '(' << B.succ_size() << "):";
5753 unsigned i = 0;
5754
5755 if (ShowColors)
5756 OS.changeColor(Color);
5757
5758 for (CFGBlock::const_succ_iterator I = B.succ_begin(), E = B.succ_end();
5759 I != E; ++I, ++i) {
5760 if (i % 10 == 8)
5761 OS << "\n ";
5762
5763 CFGBlock *B = *I;
5764
5765 bool Reachable = true;
5766 if (!B) {
5767 Reachable = false;
5768 B = I->getPossiblyUnreachableBlock();
5769 }
5770
5771 if (B) {
5772 OS << " B" << B->getBlockID();
5773 if (!Reachable)
5774 OS << "(Unreachable)";
5775 }
5776 else {
5777 OS << " NULL";
5778 }
5779 }
5780
5781 if (ShowColors)
5782 OS.resetColor();
5783 OS << '\n';
5784 }
5785 }
5786}

5788/// dump - A simple pretty printer of a CFG that outputs to stderr.
5789void CFG::dump(const LangOptions &LO, bool ShowColors) const {
5790 print(llvm::errs(), LO, ShowColors);
5791}
5792
5793/// print - A simple pretty printer of a CFG that outputs to an ostream.
5794void CFG::print(raw_ostream &OS, const LangOptions &LO, bool ShowColors) const {
5795 StmtPrinterHelper Helper(this, LO);
5796
5797 // Print the entry block.
5798 print_block(OS, this, getEntry(), Helper, true, ShowColors);
5799
5800 // Iterate through the CFGBlocks and print them one by one.
5801 for (const_iterator I = Blocks.begin(), E = Blocks.end() ; I != E ; ++I) {
5802 // Skip the entry block, because we already printed it.
5803 if (&(**I) == &getEntry() || &(**I) == &getExit())
5804 continue;
5805
5806 print_block(OS, this, **I, Helper, true, ShowColors);
5807 }
5808
5809 // Print the exit block.
5810 print_block(OS, this, getExit(), Helper, true, ShowColors);
5811 OS << '\n';
5812 OS.flush();
5813}
5814
5815size_t CFGBlock::getIndexInCFG() const {
5816 return llvm::find(*getParent(), this) - getParent()->begin();
5817}

5819/// dump - A simply pretty printer of a CFGBlock that outputs to stderr.
5820void CFGBlock::dump(const CFG* cfg, const LangOptions &LO,
5821 bool ShowColors) const {
5822 print(llvm::errs(), cfg, LO, ShowColors);
5823}
5824
5825LLVM_DUMP_METHOD void CFGBlock::dump() const {
5826 dump(getParent(), LangOptions(), false);
5827}

5829/// print - A simple pretty printer of a CFGBlock that outputs to an ostream.
5830/// Generally this will only be called from CFG::print.
5831void CFGBlock::print(raw_ostream &OS, const CFG* cfg,
5832 const LangOptions &LO, bool ShowColors) const {
5833 StmtPrinterHelper Helper(cfg, LO);
5834 print_block(OS, cfg, *this, Helper, true, ShowColors);
5835 OS << '\n';
5836}

5845/// printTerminatorJson - Pretty-prints the terminator in JSON format.
5846void CFGBlock::printTerminatorJson(raw_ostream &Out, const LangOptions &LO,
5847 bool AddQuotes) const {
5848 std::string Buf;
5849 llvm::raw_string_ostream TempOut(Buf);
5850
5851 printTerminator(TempOut, LO);
5852
5853 Out << JsonFormat(TempOut.str(), AddQuotes);

5855
5856// Returns true if by simply looking at the block, we can be sure that it
5857// results in a sink during analysis. This is useful to know when the analysis
5858// was interrupted, and we try to figure out if it would sink eventually.
5859// There may be many more reasons why a sink would appear during analysis
5860// (eg. checkers may generate sinks arbitrarily), but here we only consider
5861// sinks that would be obvious by looking at the CFG.
5862static bool isImmediateSinkBlock(const CFGBlock *Blk) {
5863 if (Blk->hasNoReturnElement())
5864 return true;
5865
5866 // FIXME: Throw-expressions are currently generating sinks during analysis:
5867 // they're not supported yet, and also often used for actually terminating
5868 // the program. So we should treat them as sinks in this analysis as well,
5869 // at least for now, but once we have better support for exceptions,
5870 // we'd need to carefully handle the case when the throw is being
5871 // immediately caught.
5872 if (std::any_of(Blk->begin(), Blk->end(), [](const CFGElement &Elm) {
5873 if (Optional<CFGStmt> StmtElm = Elm.getAs<CFGStmt>())
5874 if (isa<CXXThrowExpr>(StmtElm->getStmt()))
5875 return true;
5876 return false;
5877 }))
5878 return true;
5879
5880 return false;
5881}
5882
5883bool CFGBlock::isInevitablySinking() const {
5884 const CFG &Cfg = *getParent();
5885
5886 const CFGBlock *StartBlk = this;
5887 if (isImmediateSinkBlock(StartBlk))
5888 return true;
5889
5890 llvm::SmallVector<const CFGBlock *, 32> DFSWorkList;
5891 llvm::SmallPtrSet<const CFGBlock *, 32> Visited;
5892
5893 DFSWorkList.push_back(StartBlk);
5894 while (!DFSWorkList.empty()) {
5895 const CFGBlock *Blk = DFSWorkList.back();
5896 DFSWorkList.pop_back();
5897 Visited.insert(Blk);
5898
5899 // If at least one path reaches the CFG exit, it means that control is
5900 // returned to the caller. For now, say that we are not sure what
5901 // happens next. If necessary, this can be improved to analyze
5902 // the parent StackFrameContext's call site in a similar manner.
5903 if (Blk == &Cfg.getExit())
5904 return false;
5905
5906 for (const auto &Succ : Blk->succs()) {
5907 if (const CFGBlock *SuccBlk = Succ.getReachableBlock()) {
5908 if (!isImmediateSinkBlock(SuccBlk) && !Visited.count(SuccBlk)) {
5909 // If the block has reachable child blocks that aren't no-return,
5910 // add them to the worklist.
5911 DFSWorkList.push_back(SuccBlk);
5912 }
5913 }
5914 }
5915 }
5916
5917 // Nothing reached the exit. It can only mean one thing: there's no return.
5918 return true;
5919}
5920
5921const Expr *CFGBlock::getLastCondition() const {
5922 // If the terminator is a temporary dtor or a virtual base, etc, we can't
5923 // retrieve a meaningful condition, bail out.
5924 if (Terminator.getKind() != CFGTerminator::StmtBranch)
5925 return nullptr;
5926
5927 // Also, if this method was called on a block that doesn't have 2 successors,
5928 // this block doesn't have retrievable condition.
5929 if (succ_size() < 2)
5930 return nullptr;
5931
5932 // FIXME: Is there a better condition expression we can return in this case?
5933 if (size() == 0)
5934 return nullptr;
5935
5936 auto StmtElem = rbegin()->getAs<CFGStmt>();
5937 if (!StmtElem)
5938 return nullptr;
5939
5940 const Stmt *Cond = StmtElem->getStmt();
5941 if (isa<ObjCForCollectionStmt>(Cond) || isa<DeclStmt>(Cond))
5942 return nullptr;
5943
5944 // Only ObjCForCollectionStmt is known not to be a non-Expr terminator, hence
5945 // the cast<>.
5946 return cast<Expr>(Cond)->IgnoreParens();
5947}
5948
5949Stmt *CFGBlock::getTerminatorCondition(bool StripParens) {
5950 Stmt *Terminator = getTerminatorStmt();
5951 if (!Terminator)
5952 return nullptr;
5953
5954 Expr *E = nullptr;
5955
5956 switch (Terminator->getStmtClass()) {
5957 default:
5958 break;
5959
5960 case Stmt::CXXForRangeStmtClass:
5961 E = cast<CXXForRangeStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5962 break;
5963
5964 case Stmt::ForStmtClass:
5965 E = cast<ForStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5966 break;
5967
5968 case Stmt::WhileStmtClass:
5969 E = cast<WhileStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5970 break;
5971
5972 case Stmt::DoStmtClass:
5973 E = cast<DoStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5974 break;
5975
5976 case Stmt::IfStmtClass:
5977 E = cast<IfStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5978 break;
5979
5980 case Stmt::ChooseExprClass:
5981 E = cast<ChooseExpr>(Terminator)->getCond();
5982 break;
5983
5984 case Stmt::IndirectGotoStmtClass:
5985 E = cast<IndirectGotoStmt>(Terminator)->getTarget();
5986 break;
5987
5988 case Stmt::SwitchStmtClass:
5989 E = cast<SwitchStmt>(Terminator)->getCond();
5990 break;
5991
5992 case Stmt::BinaryConditionalOperatorClass:
5993 E = cast<BinaryConditionalOperator>(Terminator)->getCond();
5994 break;
5995
5996 case Stmt::ConditionalOperatorClass:
5997 E = cast<ConditionalOperator>(Terminator)->getCond();
5998 break;
5999
6000 case Stmt::BinaryOperatorClass: // '&&' and '||'
6001 E = cast<BinaryOperator>(Terminator)->getLHS();
6002 break;
6003
6004 case Stmt::ObjCForCollectionStmtClass:
6005 return Terminator;
6006 }
6007
6008 if (!StripParens)
6009 return E;
6010
6011 return E ? E->IgnoreParens() : nullptr;
6012}

6014//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6015// CFG Graphviz Visualization
6016//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
6017
6018#ifndef NDEBUG
6019static StmtPrinterHelper* GraphHelper;
6020#endif
6021
6022void CFG::viewCFG(const LangOptions &LO) const {
6023#ifndef NDEBUG
6024 StmtPrinterHelper H(this, LO);
6025 GraphHelper = &H;
6026 llvm::ViewGraph(this,"CFG");
6027 GraphHelper = nullptr;
6028#endif
6029}
6030
6031namespace llvm {
6032
6033template<>
6034struct DOTGraphTraits<const CFG*> : public DefaultDOTGraphTraits {
6035 DOTGraphTraits(bool isSimple = false) : DefaultDOTGraphTraits(isSimple) {}
6036
6037 static std::string getNodeLabel(const CFGBlock *Node, const CFG* Graph) {
6038#ifndef NDEBUG
6039 std::string OutSStr;
6040 llvm::raw_string_ostream Out(OutSStr);
6041 print_block(Out,Graph, *Node, *GraphHelper, false, false);
6042 std::string& OutStr = Out.str();
6043
6044 if (OutStr[0] == '\n') OutStr.erase(OutStr.begin());
6045
6046 // Process string output to make it nicer...
6047 for (unsigned i = 0; i != OutStr.length(); ++i)
6048 if (OutStr[i] == '\n') { // Left justify
6049 OutStr[i] = '\\';
6050 OutStr.insert(OutStr.begin()+i+1, 'l');
6051 }
6052
6053 return OutStr;
6054#else
6055 return {};
6056#endif
6057 }
6058};
